broker

Class Square

  • java.lang.Object
    • broker.Square

  • public class Square
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    GROUP22 Code implemented by Emily Pang This class represents an Object of type square which will contain and maintain all the necessary information for each square on the board.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Square(int toX, int toY)
      This is the default constructor which sets the x and y coordinates of this square
      Square(Square toSquare)
      This is a copy constructor that copies the Player and the x and y coordinate in toSquare

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getX()
      Returns the x coordinate of this square
      int getY()
      Returns the y coordinate of this square
      boolean isEmpty()
      This methods checks to see if this square does not have a player set in it
      Player playedBy()
      Returns a reference of the Player object stored in this square.
      void setPlayer(Player toPlayer)
      This method sets the player and checks if there is already a player stored in this square by checking if the instance variable player is null, and throws "illegal move" error if player is not null

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Square

        public Square(int toX,
              int toY)
        This is the default constructor which sets the x and y coordinates of this square
        Parameters:
        toX - The x coordinate
        toY - The y coordinate

      • Square

        public Square(Square toSquare)
        This is a copy constructor that copies the Player and the x and y coordinate in toSquare
        Parameters:
        toSquare - The Square object to copy

    • Method Detail

      • setPlayer

        public void setPlayer(Player toPlayer)
               throws IllegalMove
        This method sets the player and checks if there is already a player stored in this square by checking if the instance variable player is null, and throws "illegal move" error if player is not null
        Parameters:
        toPlayer - Player object to set to this square
        Throws:
        IllegalMove

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Returns the x coordinate of this square
        Returns:
        This square's x coordinate

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Returns the y coordinate of this square
        Returns:
        This square's y coordinate

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        This methods checks to see if this square does not have a player set in it
        Returns:
        True is there is no player stored in this square, returns false if there is a player stored in this square

      • playedBy

        public Player playedBy()
        Returns a reference of the Player object stored in this square.
        Returns:
        copy of the player object stored in this square.
